message:
Haven't posted here in a while, I noticed people were talking about browsers, and I felt that I wanted to share with you what I think is the best kept browser secret, Opera Browser. Of course you all know the name and some of you have tried it, but I do urge the ones who haven't to download it and try the adblocker, not a single add in youtube, actually only one inline showed up, unlike chrome which shows me the same ad every time I refresh, not a single pop up and a much cleaner, snappier browsing experience.

Please share your thoughts.

It's a hard situation to easily pick a side, it used to be easy to say ads are good for business until it got abused and not talking about privacy only, but even malware now get served through ads, not mentioning the horrible experience of noisy and rude ads.
I personally pay for YouTube Red to get rid of ads and still pay the content producers I admire and want to support, but I also use uBlock Origin for the general web mainly due to protect against malware.
Continuing on the ideas, has anyone had a bad experience with Opera or a web site that didn't display correctly?

I would like to chime in here and add that even the Facebook browsing experience is different, not having ads in my face is amazing, it becomes my social networking account again. I believe all these ads in the background work on your mind sending subliminal messages, and your mind just gets cluttered with all these unnecessary thoughts. Maybe this could be the reason for so many people getting ADHD or symptoms like that. On thing is for sure, I move from Windows to an OS like Debian with iceweasal once because I just wanted to get a pure experience again, an OS that was mine, no one had the right to invade my space with messages I wasn't asking for. P.S. Debian and all FOSS are exactly that, Free and Open Source, I am sure others have experience using TOR, this is similar, but does not using a diffrent netwroking protocol, and your still tracked by cookies
